info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 14 at 3:46PM MST until July 14 at 6:45PM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR WEST CENTRAL MOHAVE COUNTY... At 346 PM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Over 1 inch of rain has fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Area webcams show flooding on Pierce Ferry Road on the Archibald Wash. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... North Kingman, Dolan Springs, Pierce Ferry And Antares Roads, Packsaddle Campground, Stockton Hill Road, Windy Point Campground, Chloride, Grand Canyon Ranch and New Kingman-Butler. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
